channel.title: Renaissance.Engineer Feed
channel.description: Curated writing from minds that build across disciplines.

item.title: Containers for Emergence & Pluralism
item.author: Patricia Mou
item.description: Introduces "transubjectivity" — a shared field that flows through and beyond participants without flattening difference. Backed by two actual workshop experiments she designed and ran.

item.title: The Future Will Be Mystical
item.author: Patricia Mou
item.description: Proposes a "Mystical Commons" as new social infrastructure for post-religious spirituality. Four design elements: physical space, embodied pluralism, facilitators (not gurus), non-dogmatic ritual.

item.title: Reclaiming the Utopian Vision
item.author: Patricia Mou
item.description: Argues for "prefigurative utopianism" — embodying future ideals through present experimentation rather than top-down blueprints. Case studies from Auroville to Bhutan.

item.title: What is a Fourth Place?
item.author: Patricia Mou
item.description: Her signature concept: "fourth places" as spaces where the primary activity is meaning-making, distinct from Oldenburg's third places. Traces precedents from Athenian agoras to Viennese coffee houses.

item.title: 5000 Years of Compute & Design Co-Evolution
item.author: Daanish Shabbir
item.description: How computational capabilities have enabled increasingly sophisticated design across five millennia, from Bronze Age templates to Tesla's battery pack optimization via modern computational dashboards.

item.title: Named 2025 Schmidt Polymath
item.author: Saad Bhamla
item.description: The first Georgia Tech recipient of the Schmidt Polymath Award — up to $2.5M over five years — to develop AI-enabled point-of-care diagnostics and autonomous morphing machines at planetary scale.

item.title: Bioprinting Living Sculptures
item.author: Stephanie Zhang
item.description: How does order emerge from chaos through complex dynamical systems? 3D-bioprinted self-assembling living sculptures using novel bioinks of fungal and cellular matter, treating the creative process as a ritual of transfiguration.

item.title: ARTIFICE: Where Design Meets Speculative Fiction
item.author: Renaise Kim
item.description: A multi-disciplinary studio built on the conviction that the most powerful design decisions are born from speculative thinking. The studio is a conceptual space shaped by science fiction.

item.title: Ultrafast Elastocapillary Fans Control Agile Maneuvering in Ripple Bugs and Robots
item.author: Saad Bhamla
item.description: Rhagovelia ripple bugs use specialized middle-leg fans powered by surface tension — not muscles — to navigate fast-moving streams. The discovery inspired novel propulsion systems for miniature aquatic robots.

item.title: MIRROR: Modular Internal Processing for Personalized Safety in LLM Dialogue
item.author: Nicole Hsing
item.description: A dual-process cognitive architecture (Thinker + Talker) implementing persistent inner monologue in LLMs. 21% average improvement — up to 156% — in safety-critical scenarios across GPT-4o, Claude, Gemini, Llama, and Mistral.

item.title: From Solo Founder to Visionary CEO: Leading Arcarae AI
item.author: Nicole Hsing
item.description: Teaching herself AI research, software development, and design to build Arcarae from a solo research project into a funded company creating immersive universes for self-discovery.

item.title: Reversible Kink Instability Drives Ultrafast Jumping in Nematodes and Soft Robots
item.author: Saad Bhamla
item.description: Nematode worms use a reversible kink instability to achieve ultrafast jumping. The finding inspired a legless soft robot that can jump 10 feet high.

item.title: Computational Public Space
item.author: Bret Victor
item.description: Integrating computation into cities through 'communal computing' — a screenless approach where people collaborate in shared physical spaces rather than isolated with devices. Explores seven value tensions relevant to urban design.

item.title: ML Weather Forecasting
item.author: Daanish Shabbir
item.description: ML-based weather forecasting (e.g. DeepMind's GenCast) began outperforming traditional numerical methods in 2024. A call for interpretability research to understand what concepts these models actually learn.

item.title: Eden: Ecological Programming for Architecture
item.author: Neri Oxman
item.description: A computational framework for data-driven, cross-scale generative design guided by environmental simulation and AI. The conceptual Eden Tower demonstrates how buildings can maximize biodiversity, resilience, and ecosystem services.

item.title: 3 Puzzles in Optoelectronics
item.author: Daanish Shabbir
item.description: Energy constraints in information processing and the optical solutions — electroabsorptive modulators that can achieve ~10 femtojoules per bit by decade's end.

item.title: Man-Nahata: Architectural Studies for Megalopolis
item.author: Neri Oxman
item.description: Four-part model installation envisioning a potential future design of Manhattan, created as architectural and scientific advisor to Francis Ford Coppola's film Megalopolis.

item.title: Iris van Herpen: Paris Fashion Week F/W 2024
item.author: Stephanie Zhang
item.description: Design work for Iris van Herpen's Fall/Winter 2024 Paris Fashion Week collection, applying bio-design sensibility to haute couture at the intersection of fashion, science, and engineering.

item.title: Unifying Fluidic Excretion Across Life from Cicadas to Elephants
item.author: Saad Bhamla
item.description: Cicadas are the smallest animals to create high-speed urine jets. A unifying framework for fluidic excretion across the entire animal kingdom, with implications for micro-nozzle engineering.

item.title: Physics Representations
item.author: Daanish Shabbir
item.description: Five representational upgrades in physics — from Euclidean geometry to neural abstractions. 'The fundamental epistemic unit is now shifting, as we move through the cusp of the neural age.'

item.title: Kashmir Point
item.author: Daanish Shabbir
item.description: A young laborer from Bagh works in an architectural studio in Kashmir Point, building miniature models of buildings and developing a forbidden bond with the employer's son. Fiction that bridges engineering and literature.

item.title: Declaration of Interdependence
item.author: Daanish Shabbir
item.description: We are caught in an inescapable network of mutuality, tied in a single garment of destiny. A literary-hacker manifesto for reimagining digital futures through collective authorship.

item.title: Augmenting Human Intelligence, Exploring the Cosmic Medium
item.author: Jacob Cole
item.description: A 2.5-hour conversation on how IdeaFlow enhances human cognition, deep learning theories, consciousness, Eastern philosophy, and the intersection of humanistic inquiry with technological innovation.

item.title: The Hypertext Web is the Real Metaverse
item.author: Jacob Cole
item.description: The tangled, densely connected modern web is itself a proto-Metaverse. Building a web that feels like a place designed for life would realize the vision without VR headsets.

item.title: Paperfuge: An Ultra-Low-Cost Hand-Powered Paper Centrifuge
item.author: Saad Bhamla
item.description: A 20-cent paper centrifuge inspired by a whirligig toy that separates blood plasma in 90 seconds without electricity. Used for diagnosing malaria in resource-limited settings.

item.title: Krebs Cycle of Creativity
item.author: Neri Oxman
item.description: A map of the four domains of human creativity — Science, Engineering, Design, and Art — and the 12 modalities of knowledge flow between them. Anti-disciplinarity as practice.

item.title: Inventing on Principle
item.author: Bret Victor
item.description: Creators need an immediate connection to what they create. If there is any delay in the feedback loop between thinking something and seeing it, there is a whole world of ideas which will never be.
